intro: Silene verecunda subsp. platyota, commonly known as the flat-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Silene verecunda subsp. platyota is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms.
